Module to simplify data set analysis.

Explanation here.

Module to plot the data set.

Bases: object

Tool to simplify data set plotting.

Methods

Add a data set to be used.

get_regression_model_summary(df_name, ...[, ...])

Plot a regression model based on variables to be studied.

plot_bivariate_graphs(df_name, numeric_variables)

Plot a bivariate pairplot from the numeric variables in the data set.

plot_correlation_heatmap(df_name, ...)

Plot a correlation heatmap using the numeric variables in the data set.

plot_interactive(data_frames)

Plot data sets on a preset 2D interactive chart.

Plot an univariate pairplot from the numeric variables in the data set.
add_data_set(df_name: str, data_frame: DataFrame, disable_feedback: bool = False) → None[source]#

Add a data set to be used.

Parameters:
df_namestr

Name to give the data set.

data_framepd.DataFrame

Data set as pandas DataFrame.

disable_feedbackbool

Decide whether a confirmation message should be displayed or not.

Returns:
None.
get_regression_model_summary(df_name: str, target_variable: str, predictor_variables: list[str], disable_feedback: bool = False, disable_plotting: bool = False)[source]#

Plot a regression model based on variables to be studied.

Parameters:
df_namestr

Name of the data set to be plotted.

target_variablestr

Variable to be predicted.

predictor_variableslist[str]

Input variables on which the output would be based.

disable_feedbackbool

Whether to print feedbacks, like a model summary, into the console.

disable_plottingbool

Whether the regression model should be plotted.

Returns:
Model summary.
plot_bivariate_graphs(df_name: str, numeric_variables: list[str]) → None[source]#

Plot a bivariate pairplot from the numeric variables in the data set.

Parameters:
df_namestr

Name of the data set to be plotted.

numeric_variableslist[str]

Choose numeric variables to plot by entering the name of the variable in the list.

Returns:
None.
plot_correlation_heatmap(df_name: str, numeric_variables: list[str]) → None[source]#

Plot a correlation heatmap using the numeric variables in the data set.

Parameters:
df_namestr

Name of the data set to be plotted.

numeric_variableslist[str]

Choose numeric variables to plot by entering the name of the variable in the list.

Returns:
None.
plot_interactive(data_frames: dict) → None[source]#

Plot data sets on a preset 2D interactive chart.

Parameters:
data_framesdict

Specifies the data sets and columns to use. First mentioned column will be on x-axis. Columns specified as x-axis must be exactly the same.

Example: {‘berlin’: [‘date’, ‘rain_sum’], ‘paris’: [‘date’, ‘temperature’]}

Returns:
None.
plot_univariate_graphs(df_name: str, number_columns_unvariate_graphs: int) → None[source]#

Plot an univariate pairplot from the numeric variables in the data set.

Parameters:
df_namestr

Name of the data set to be plotted.

number_columns_unvariate_graphsint

Decide on how many rows the plots should be displayed.

Returns:
None.
